answers.author: Lana Hygh
answers.text:
Our standard procedure guidelines requires that, once a new or revised standard procedure is approved, the originating department must communicate that change to everyone affected by it:  "The originating department will notify Town staff (All Email Users) that the procedure is available and note the major provisions of the procedure.  In the case of an updated procedure, the department will explain what the changes are and the purpose behind the changes."  They are also responsible for additional training, if needed.

answers.author: Michael Baker
answers.text:
While we don't have any policies or procedures to share, in thinking about the question, I suggest that an effective policy would need to recognize and place appropriate responisbility with managers/supervisors to understand and communicate the impact of changes to organizational policies.   So if you intend to plan and conduct training sessions, perhaps that's the audience that should be targeted, with the understanding that one of the supervisors' basic responsibilities is to clearly communicate and reinforce policy changes to their direct reports.  Good luck.

Administrative Policies are initiated and/or approved and maintained in the Town Manager's Office.  Policies are sent out electronically to departments and are available on the document management system and intranet for all employees to access.

answers.author: Joshua Smith
answers.text:
Jennifer,
Please see below a link to our online Policies & Procedures Manual.  We divide policies into three primary categories - Administrative Directives; Village Board Policies; and Large Policy Documents.
http://www.villageofhoward.com/policy_procedure.cfm
To answer your question directly, when a new policy or procedure is created, we provide that information electronically to all employees who have an email address, we post the new policy or procedure on internal bulletin boards and finally, we ask that all Large Management Team members provide copies to their direct reports.

author: Jennifer Frederick
text:
Do you have a policy on communicating new/amended policies to staff?  We're updating our policy and procedure manual and would like to have some sort of procedure on how to make sure everyone is made aware of changes/new policies.  (i.e. distributing pages to replace in manual and have employees sign off, training session going over new policies as they are adopted, etc)
Do you have a standard/formal procedure in place to educate staff about new policies?
If so, please advise.  If possible, attach a document outlining the procedure taken.
thank you in advance!
title: Policy and Procedure Manual Updates
